Reviews.Content: Amazing. This hotel was certainly one of the best Embassies I have ever stayed in in my life. The atmosphere is very elegant and the staff was incredibly helpful. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: da-reef
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say how good the manager was. When we arrived they made us wait 2 hours for our room after check-in-time. We made the reservations 2 months in advance. After talking to the manager he took care of us and made everything right again. His name is Zarko Lucic. The Embassy Suites is lucky to have a person of his experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kewilli
Reviews.Content: My husband, my mom, my two daughters, 3 and 8, and I stayed at this beautiful hotel for 4 nights and had a great stay. It is a beautiful hotel with a great koi pond that my 3 year old loved. Although it was beautiful it was still comfortable. Sometimes I cringe when my kids are walking through very nice places because I'm afraid they'll touch something, but not here. The staff is friendly and the breakfast is awesome. We found something for everyone, even my picky eaters! We will stay there the next time we go on vacation! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: VaBest1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms are small but nice, a lot of parking (kind of expensive $19 a day and I was there 18 days) and they had a free washer and dryer on the floor I was staying on. The breakfast wasn't bad the one time that I had time to eat. Love the free beer and wine from 1730 to 1930. The internet wasn't free, but I think had I been a diamond member it would have. Great hotel for a few nights. I had no real poblems. I wish parents wouldn't allow their kids run in the hotel as if they was running outdoors. Not really the place for kids to be running anyway. May stay was from Apr 12, 2010 till Apr 30, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzylg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel lobby was nice and my son loved the Koi fish in the pond. The bed was very comfortable. We had a room on a high floor which I had requested, I would say it would be pretty noisy in your living room where the sofa bed is if you had a room on a lower floor and near the elevator. The living areas all face the atrium and the noise from downstairs does drift upstairs, nice and quiet in the bedroom though. My main criticism was the location of the internal doors, they were ridiculous. The one through to the bedroom was right next to the cupboard door where the microwave was, you had to shut the bedroom door all the time to open the cupboard door to use the microwave. It was very awkward, just bad planning when they constructed it!! Also, the parking was $19 a day, don't bother paying for this. Park on the road, there is plenty of parking on the streets around the hotel so save your money. It was fairly close to the freeway so easy to get to Sea World, about 15 minutes. We also went to Legoland which was about a 20 minute drive north just off the freeway. There was a PF Changs right outside the hotel which was great and also a Westfield shopping centre across the road too which had Sears and Macys plus lots of other shops. Breakfast was included and there was also a happy hour/manager's reception every day from 5-7pm which was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Tusich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights over Easter weekend. Check in was quick - we arrived at 1 pm, and our room was ready despite of the fact that check in time, I think, is 4 pm. Suite was a little bit dark, but I guess, all suites are like this unless you take a corner suite with the balcony. Room was clean and noise level is OK. I didn't hear our neighbors upstaires or in the next room. Location is OK - it took us 10 mins to drive to drive to La Mesa and dine at their "Red Lobster". La Jolla shores are 10 mins away as well. It was nice to stroll there in the evening. Seaworld is 15 mins away on I-5. Breakfast and happy hour every day are included in room price. Breakfast could be a little better though. Very limited amount of fruits and veggies. Only banana and oranges, and actually no veggies at all. No yougurt or cottage cheese. At least, Hilton Suites include those items in their free breakfast. Evening happy hour included all kinds of wine and coctails (with the show of ID and your room key), chips and salsa, pretzels and slices of pita bread with little bit of hummus on them. Indoor pool was always crowded though, with kids in particular. I booked this hotel because of it's indoor pool knowing that it can be chilly in SoCal in March-April. My daughter swam there, however, all days - in the morning and in the evening, but I coulldn't get it because of tons of screaming and splashing kids. But that's Ok with me, I didn't want to swim anyways... Pool towels were too tiny, but I guess, it's OK for the kids. Oh, and no robes in the room (just comparing it with Hilton Suites). Also, there was too much chlorine in the pool - I could't comb my daughter's hair after each swim... We haven't tried their restaurant "Indulge", but it looked nice in the evening, especially the patio with heated lamps, couches with pillows and fire pits. Not sure if we'll return to this place next time. May be if the prices will be cheaper. I paid around $150 per night. Once again comparing to earlier stay at Hilton Suites, where we stayed in corner suite - light and bright - and where I paid $90 per night.... Oh, and they charge $19 for parking per night, and it's not a vallet (Hilton charged $12)...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Good area”
Reviews.Author: SDNX
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Embassy Suites I have stayed at. Very good area for restaurants and entertainment within walking distance. Parking is a little steep and the garage is small. Rooms are large and clean. Breakfast and evening drinks are nice and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Garage Sux”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing I have to gripe about this place is the Garage. It is small and not really set up for the two-way traffic down one-way lanes. There is no elevator service, despite being three levels tall. The stairs to levels 2 and 3 are uneven and actually tilt you forward for a bit. There is no attendant at this lot (at $19 per day), so you must enter your credit card at a machine that sometimes doesn't work. Great hotel otherwise. Super friendly service - excellent PF Chang's right across the driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites always realiable but noisy air con”
Reviews.Author: Buddy3567
Reviews.Content: We chose the Embassy Suites because you know what you are getting and this one doesn't disappoint. La Jolla is a lovely area and having first booked in the Gaslamp District we were very pleased we changed at the last minute. Only downside was the noisy air conditioning so often a feature in American hotels. It was just too hot without it at night but so noisy that we had to raise our voices above it. Perhaps we were unlucky and other rooms would be better.

Reviews.Title: “High extra fees **BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: brt925
Reviews.Content: I love Embassy Suites but the extra fees at the La Jolla site made our stay unpleasant. A charge of $19 per night for parking is TOO MUCH.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but watch out for the fees/extras”
Reviews.Author: tennesseine
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego on business for two nights and picked Embassy Suites for the Hilton points. Clean, sleek building, decent rooms, pool (didn't use), OK-ish workout room, food wasn't bad. But they charge for both parking and internet, so add another $30 a day for these. Had it not been for the staff, I wouldn't even be bothering to write this review. I typically only write reviews when it is very good (and thus want to steer people to the business) or very bad (feel a duty to warn fellow travelers!). So an OK-ish hotel wouldn't merit my time, but I feel I have to take a moment to recognize the fact that while the hotel is not a great value or particularly outstanding in other respects, the kindness and professionalism of the staff merit a note: -I woke up one morning and was immediately buried in work and before I knew it, I had missed breakfast. I called down to ask if maybe there was still food at the buffet and they said it had already been cleared away. Two minutes later, they called back and said, "Can I get the kitchen to whip you up an omelet or something?" They brought it to my room ten minutes later, no charge. That small kindness just changed my outlook on the day and really reduced my stress level! I wish I had gotten the lady's name to recognize her above-and-beyond help. -Next day, I checked out and left in a rush to catch my 6 AM flight up to SFO. Got to security and realized I had left ALL my hanging clothes in the closet back at my room..pair of pants, jacket and two shirts. I called the hotel and a very nice person in housekeeping promised to send them to me. Two days after I got home, they were there: they had UPSed them two-day express. Again, above and beyond. So next time in San Diego, extra $30 or not, I am staying at the Embassy Suites there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but watch out for fee! Business travelers beware!”
Reviews.Author: nvychk
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the hotel - from the comfortable and clean rooms, to the delicious and plentiful breakfast, and the friendly and helpful staff. It's a gorgeous facility with a great location, plus it's easy to get in and out of. However, I was severely disappointed when I went to check out and found a large fee on my bill for checking out early. In my business, it's typical for us to book rooms for longer than ends up being necessary, because we may or may not stay an extra day, depending on what happens in our meetings. Because I left a day earlier than planned, I was charged 1/2 a day's rate. I was upset about this because I was not told this would be an issue and had NEVER had this problem at any other hotel. When I argued with the staff, I was asked "Weren't you told about this when you checked in?" I was not, and replied so. As a result, I warn all business travelers to this hotel to make sure you nail down the number of days you're going to stay before you check in!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: arun0708
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for family, we directly booked thru the hotel site, we paid $141 per night, (including 19$ parking) in last week of december, stayed for 6 nights. kids enjoyed the pool, hot tub. Made to order breakfast is included and it is good but very crowded during holiday times. couple of days they ran out of certain items and was not refilled, one day I spoke to the staff and then she made sure that everything was refilled, They need to improve their service for morning breakfast when it is crowded. They also have an evening soft drinks/wine/drinks complimentary service at the atrium. The restaurant in the hotel is very average with not many choices for kids. They also have few (about 4-5 washer/dryers) which was useful. need to get your own soap but dryer is free. Otherwise it s a comfortable and nice stay. I recommend the place for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Rooms, Terrible Situation but Nice Recovery”
Reviews.Author: gooner_cb21rf
Reviews.Content: I took my family to this hotel along with two other families for a nice quick visit to Sea World and some other relaxation. Other than a very unfortunate situation that I'll describe below, we had a great visit and would certainly return. Pros: Newly refurbished rooms that are very nicely furnished. Living room faces hallway which gives the bedroom some noise buffer. The free breakfast and happy hour are awesome. The fitness room is brand new and has the best cardio equipment I've seen in a hotel. Cons: The $19 parking/night tops the list. This feels like robbery, so definitely walk the block or two and use the free street parking. I hate paying for internet but given the room rate we were able to get and it being $10 per 24 hrs I can't complain too much. The big con we experienced on our trip was the obscenely loud new year's eve party that was booked at the hotel. I'm a reasonable person and NYE is the night to party. But I consider it the hotel's responsibility to ensure that all guests' needs and desires are met equally. The noise was so intrusive and pervasive that it was really unacceptable. The party basically turned the lobby/courtyard into a nightclub with all the noise. From our living room, the music was LOUD and with young children trying to sleep, this was a nightmare. We called down to the front desk and were met with the rude response of "well, it IS New Year's Eve" along with a very half-hearted "I will see what I can do". My wife was so upset that she went down to the front desk and asked to speak with the general manager. At this point, I have to really compliment the general manager (David). Seeing that moving rooms at 10:45PM was not an option for us, The GM listened to our request for partial compensation and graciously agreed. He was courteous, apologetic, and said that he had young kids of his own so he understood the situation. Clearly he was put in a bad situation by whoever from special events/catering booked the party and failed to manage it, but he did a very good job turning a big negative into a decent situation.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and well located”
Reviews.Author: geronimoturtle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night as we needed to be in La Jolla for Thanksgiving. Had two rooms, a king and two doubles for my sister and her family. Our room, though next door was far larger and superior. Go for a King if you don't need the extra bed. Comfortable bed, coffee machine and nice flat screen tv. Iron and ironing board in the room came in useful. The kids love the hotel, they can run around and make a noise, swim and use the hot tub! As many other reviewers have mentioned, breakfast to order, not chased from our table after serving time. Shame they feel the need to charge for internet and don't haver free wifi in the hotel. Great location for the mall if you want to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beatledude64
Reviews.Content: The staff was really nice, the hotel itself was very clean and good looking. The rooms are very nice. The free hot breakfast was very good too. The only complaints I have is that the internet isn't free, and the line for the breakfast seemed really long. Overall, it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with kids”
Reviews.Author: melonbar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice in that, it's close to shopping mall and most of the restaurants. The hotel has nice big atrium, where complimentary made to order breakfast is served. The area where hotel is nice area and it's ten minutes from the coast. The rooms really need remodeling, since the carpet in the room is worned out.

Reviews.Title: “Dependably nice”
Reviews.Author: ps92
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and always like it. Typical Embassy Suites rooms. Love the breakfast and happy hour. We especially like being able to walk across the street to the UTC outdoor mall. Great place for all of us to shop. 10 minute drive to the beach. Near 2 major highways so easy access to downtown San Diego. Safe neighborhood to walk around. Just right for a family trip. No need to pay expensive daily parking in narrow garage. Plenty of free on street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brookey109
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a two room suite. The room was a good size, clean, comfy bed. The hotel has a cool koi pond/waterfalls in the lobby which were nice. As was the free happy hour and breakfast. The hotel wasn't full while we were there, so there were never long lines for food or a lack of tables. Yes the parking fee kinda stinks, but we figured we got our money back by not having to buy breakfast for two days, and with the free drinks at happy hour. The hotel is right off the highway and only minutes from La Jolla. There is a mall across the street which came in handy since we had a suitcase break and were leaving from San Diego for a cruise. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better on week days”
Reviews.Author: kevgy
Reviews.Content: Up to the standard I would expect from Embassy Suites except overnight car parking is rather expensive at $19. The hotel was clearly popular at the weekend, with the infamous breakfast queues if you get your timing wrong and turn up just before breakfast is scheduled to finish. On week days, I didn't have to queue to get a freshly cooked early breakfast but queues built up around the end of breakfast session, when there is an alternative of self-service scrambled egg, bacon and sausage as well as the usual selection of cereals, cakes and bread and muffins for toasting. My room, or rather my suite, was lavishly spacious. The hotel is just across the road from a low rise shopping centre but it was necessary to drive some distance to get to the beach. The hotel bar & restaurant was pleasantly informal and relaxing and well used compared to the typical sparsely used formal restaurant one might expect in that class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: retro_librarian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while we were on the second part of our honeymoon. It was perfect! The "romance package" was a nice touch. As like all other Embassy Suites, there was a beautiful atrium, complimentary breakfast served every morning, and complimentary beverages (and snacks) served each evening. The breakfast and evening reception are two of my favorite things about this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: taxcpa
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites, in a good way. We really enjoyed our stay there, and would definitely stay again. The rooms and staff were nice, the hotel was nice with a big, beautiful koi pond in the lobby that the kids liked, the free internet in the business center was helpful, the breakfast was good with an excellent selection (hint: don't be late, they close it down right on time), and the location was great - 20 min or less to all major attractions, including the beach. Lots of restaurants and a nice mall close by with a playground for small children. The few negatives are: the sofa bed was awful - it was ridiculously uncomfortable. The mattress felt like springs with a sheet on top. Every spring was sticking out. They really need to replace them. I had a relative staying in another room, and her sofa bed was the same way, so it wasn't just our room. Also, other Embassy Suites I've stayed in had a nice kitchenette. This just had a very small area behind the door - the fridge didn't get very cold, and there was no freezer, which was disappointing. Still, it was nice to have the sink, fridge and microwave, however, small. The pool is nice for adults (even has a sauna) but definitely not a place for kids to play, so if your family expects to hang out in the pool, this is not the place. It's indoors, and is just a small rectangle pool with no shallow area for kids to play, not even large steps to hang out on. Also, the hotel rooms could really use a shelf or two in the bathroom. If you have more than one person, there's nowhere to put toiletries, etc. other than on the sink. If they just stuck a shelf on the wall, it would really help create more storage space. Lastly, they could really use a little noise buffer from the lobby, like more plants. All the rooms surround the lobby, and even though we were high up on the Honors floor, the noise still drifted up when there was happy hour or a band playing. We were prepared for the parking cost, we just considered it part of the overall cost of the hotel, however, it's very inconvenient - three stories with no elevator and only one lane in the garage - two cars can't pass eachother, one needs to back out for the other to get by. The front desk had conveniently printed directions to every surrounding location, which was very helpful. The hotel was comfortable overall and relatively quiet, with helpful staff and was in a good location, so we enjoyed ourselves very much, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Expensive Parking For Suburban Area”
Reviews.Author: StealthySteven
Reviews.Content: A long 5 minute wait at check in, but the room was nice and quiet. Kids seemed to be running all around the hotel public areas without supervision during the free cocktail hours, playing with elevators, etc. Parking fee seems pricey for this location. Free street parking is available within one or two blocks of the hotel, so I avoided using the hotel garage. Five hours after checking out, I realized that we had left a cell phone in the room and returned to the hotel to see if they had found it. A very nice assistant manager went back to the housekeeping area and discovered that it had been found and tagged by the room maid with our room number and date of stay. Needless to say I was very pleased to get the phone back. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great- but parking could be a major problem for some people.”
Reviews.Author: tikilounge
Reviews.Content: Great Embassy Suites- better than usual decor. Terrific location- can walk to PF Changs and the mall. Short drive to La Jolla atrractions. Reasonable drive to San Diego attractions and airport. But there is one major oddity- the parking. First- it's $19/ day. I can live with that. But it's not a parking lot, it's a parking garage and there is no elevator. Even for me, that made hauling my bags in (having to carry them down flights of stairs a pain). Also, there is no valet option. I'm not sure what they were thinking- but it certainly was not about people with disabilities, small children, or luggage. It's nice to have the two room suite, but I'm only one person and could have lived with a smaller room. I'm a Hilton Diamond member so I always prefer the Hilton family of hotels, which includes ES, but next time I may try the Marriott right down the street- which has balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: sheiksan
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites. Outdoor jacuzzi; indoor pool. Reasonably nice gym. Must pay for internet access in room; free internet is available downstairs but it can get very busy. You can eat outdoors as well. Staff was great. What really makes it nice is the location. Right next to P.K. Changs, across the street from a mall (that has a 24hr fitness). Lots of restaurants of many price ranges in the vicinity (short driving distances). If you are a cyclist there are lots of places to ride, but you have to be comfortable with big roads. And some roads are pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when traveling with kids.”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaTaylor
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites due to the cleanliness and kid friendly enviroment. The staff was very friendly and kind enough to ship my UPS package off for me without any cost at all. Room service was friendly and fast. P.F Changs is right across the street for you to grab a nice bite with friends and family. If you just so happen to forget an item of clothing, like I did, the mall is right across the street for you to pick up some quick threads. We stayed here to attend Sea World and would enjoy booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 808traveler
Reviews.Content: I had considered staying at the Hyatt La Jolla but was glad that I stayed at the Embassy Suites (La Jolla). The rooms are typical Embassy Suite rooms, one living room with a flat screen LG television, a desk for your laptop computer and a couch with a pull out sofa. There is also a small bar with sink, a microwave and a refrigerator. The bedroom had a tube television (pretty good size and picture) and a nice king size bed. There are free washers/dryers if you need to wash your clothes. The complimentary breakfast was excellent (cooked to order omlettes, eggs, sausages, bacon, variety of toasts and pastries, oatmeal, fruits, dry cereal with milk and a variety of juices). The breakfast is from 6:00 am to 9:00 am but it's best to go early and avoid the crowd (it never really got too busy). They also have a FREE cocktail hour from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm where they serve free alcohol and mixed drinks. The parking lot isn't too big and they charge $19 a day. There is a pretty good mall right across the street and a P.F. Chang's restaurant right outside the lobby. The location is good (a minute away from the 805 and a few minutes away from the I-5). You can't go wrong if you're staying in La Jolla!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BelindaRosevilleCA
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Orig booked back in Jan, but checked rates again in June and got the same room for half the price! Nice location - next door to tons of restaurants, a shopping mall and ten min drive to down town La Jolla. We asked for a midfloor room, away from the dreaded ice machine and noisy evelator. The staff were very friendly - all went above and beyond what you would expect. Our room was nicely appointed - microwave, mini fridge, super clean. Housekeeping rushed over to bring extra`s when requested. Breakfast was excellent. Try to make it down prior to 8am, or expect to wait, (school`s out so nothing new there?!). We chose to sit ouside on the patio, which was nice. Indoor pool was super - my kids met up with other`s in the pm, and swam for hours. Big hotel with an intimate, friendly atmosphere. Just two area`s that could be improved upon - evening snacks were limited - veggies or pizza silces (even at a cost), would have been appreciated. The onsite parking is $19, also one way - so lots of backing up to let others past. Try down town La Jolla on Sunday - live music and a fun time. You can download directions to the local attractions in the hotels business office. We had great fun and look forward to visiting ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: craigandstef
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation at least 3 weeks ahead of time requesting a lower floor suite. This particular Embassy Suites is 12 stories and I'm not great with heights and made that very plain to them. They didn't seem too interested in our request. You guessed it! Our suite was on the 11th floor damn, my worst nightmare. Now parking. At every Embassy Suites I've stayed at we've had complimentary parking unless of course you use valet. This one in La Jolla you park yourself and it's a $19 a day, I'm serious! Wow...horrors. Please make sure if you're looking for your microwave and your refrigeratorcheck inside the closet next to your bathroom. Internet service? You bet and it's $9.95 a day to use. One more thing, when the air conditioner comes on at night you REALLY hear it when trying to sleep. Bring your ocean machine and earplugs or take a xanax. We did like Indulge the restaurant. Dan the bartender was personable and made our stay most enjoyable considering the other challenges. I believe you can find better deals elsewhere in La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roystravels45
Reviews.Content: Small breakfast area. Very difficult to get in and out of the one-way parking structure. Suggest staying at one of the nearby hotels like Hyatt, Hilton, etc.....

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Sports Teams”
Reviews.Author: RichieBAz
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel BUT, it is also a hotel that caters to kids soccer teams, B-ball, any youth team where they can pack 200 kids into a room. Thus, kids running around all the time. One fun trick is to push every button on the elevator. Parking structure is way too small and they charge for it, parked or not. Always full at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_WarEagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a full week (6 nights / 7 days) . This hotel is within walking distance to several great dining and shopping options in the University Town Center (literally across the street) and bit further to the Costa Verde shopping / dining center. The free cooked to order breakfast was amazing. At first I did not know how extravagant I could (or wanted to) order so I started with a basic omelet (the seemingly most popular order) with your choice of meats, vegetables, and cheese. The next morning I asked for pancakes which were amazing. The cooks will pile on the sides unless you ask them not to. My only complaint was that at around 4:30 am I awoke to the smell of bacon cooking as the cooks were preparing for the morning, but breakfast didn't start until 6am. The best feature was the Manager's Reception featuring complimentary beer (good and bad bear, a locally brewed La Jolla Ale or Bud light), Wine, cocktails, soft drinks and pretzels / chips and salsa. The open floor plan of the lower level gives a great chance to mingle with other guests or to just relax and people watch (there is a hi def tv as well usually on a sports channel, sometimes on news). There were two TVs in my room, a King Suite, one 32inch flat panel in the living room and one large tube TV in the bedroom. The refrigerator had no freezer in my room, but there was a microwave and sink, which worked perfectly for left overs. In the living room there was a desk, a desk chair, a one and two seat sofa. I tried out the outdoor heated jacuzzi and the steam room. Both were very relaxing. Internet is $10 per day, so I used their business center which had everything I needed, internet and a printer. Parking is expensive (19 a day) but this is standard for the area, and at least the parking spots are very close to the hotel. Overall this hotel well worth the price, once you factor in all of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Beverleyblvd
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults 2 kids age 9 & 11) stayed at this hotel March 23-27. Room on 8th floor was nice - 1 King bed with flat screen in separate room, bathroom, closets, sofa bed, flat screen, desk & chair, and side chair in front room. There was also a fridge in a closet across from a separate sink - bar area. Didn`t see until 2nd day because the doors to the bathroom and main room open strangely and into the closet where the fridge is. The room was on the smallish side for 4 people - if the kids were older we would have to have 2 rooms as they shared the sofa bed. The sofa bed was uncomfortable for them so after the first night I requested a mattress pad which was brought up within 10 minutes. They were much more comfortable after that and no complaints. Breakfast included each day was pretty good - nice to have a bite without having to decide where to go. Some days the omelete station was the only hot food choice (with bacon, sausage, etc.) and other days there were hot trays with scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage. The omelete station was open every day and the cooks are super fast. Less than two minutes wait for the food. Other choices were pancakes, fruit, cereals, muffins, bread, coffee, tea, juices. We ate in the atrium every morning and were not disappointed at all - we ate and were ready to go. There is a nightly cocktail reception which is also a nice touch. Premium liquor is offered as well as soft drinks and nachos, chips, etc. We found a place to sit and enjoy. Again - all included in the price of the room. Free internet room - great to have although I didn`t realize it until our 2nd last day. The kids found the pool to be fun and I sat with them in the hot tub which was nice. Can``t comment on the gym but looked in and saw a few machines as well as free weights as well as tv. The location is great - close to everything - ie Zoo, Legoland, Sea World, SS Midway, etc. Just a short drive to each and easy to find. Also a good restaurant in the hotel as well as PF Chang``s next door. There is a mall across the street - we walked over and ate at Cozymel`s which we all enjoyed. Ask the front desk for a list of restaurants nearby and they will provide a long one with distances to each and whether they are formal or informal and descriptions of each place. Overall - Embassy Suites was a decent hotel with a good breakfast and cocktail hour included. Our kids enjoyed feeding the Koi fish in the lobby and the glass elevators. We would recommend this place and would stay here again. Just make sure you have good directions if you arrive at night as we did. Got lost a few times as we were not too familiar with San Diego and there are no street lamps on the highways! Couldn``t see a thing! The daytime was much easier to navigate in!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brokecheerdad
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. They even offer a discount for family members of UCSD students. No complaints, very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that was centrally located and the Embassy Suites in La Jolla did not disappoint. It is located about 20 mins from Legoland, 15 mins from San Diego Zoos and attractions, and 10 mins from La Jolla Cove. The staff is very friendly and service is superb. They make everyone feel very comfortable. Minor issues: would be nice if they had queen beds instead of doubles, can be very busy during breakfast and noisy in the atrium, Wi Fi is extra but they have a free business center where you can have internet and printing for free as well free WiFi in the atrium, parking also is a bit steep but well worth it since it is hard to find street parking. Definitely would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “They Were Wonderful To Us”
Reviews.Author: sheston
Reviews.Content: The day we checked in was the day our Marine son returned from Iraq and he had no place to stay. Embassy Suites was very accomodating until he found a place and we were treated Royally! It was a very emotional time for us and we appreciate everything they did.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: lbhtd
Reviews.Content: A relaxing trip to San Diego. The rooms were pleasing, the breakfast was good, bed comfy. The hotel is VERY family friendly. The only minor complaint is the exorbitant parking fees and the atrium noises can be heard on the eigth floor. It is also worth noting that the hotel is in a busy area, no where to take a leisurely family stroll.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: This is a great embassy suites. Everything was enjoyable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The pool was great. I love the embassy suites in the san diego area. they are my first choice in SoCal. They are excellent hotels especially if you have young children. Obviously you can't beat embassy suites breakfast....especially the SD properties. The location is good. There is a mall accross the street and you have easy access to two interstates. Close to SD and carlsbad. I will definitely recommend that you try this hotel if you are staying in SD and you have children with you. It is conducive to a family environment. It's not the most peaceful/quiet hotel though...but when traveling with my kids I don't expect peace and quiet. The parking is very expensive at this hotel...valet and self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for families”
Reviews.Author: dwtn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a La Jolla weekend with our young children. Pros: * great value for families: spacious rooms (all suites) and breakfast included * location in heart of "UTC" area of La Jolla (UTC being the large mall across the way); short drive to the upscale beach area of La Jolla Cons: * tough self-parking situation with unmanned (and no elevator) parking lot for $18 if you do not want to valet park for $30 * lots of families with kids means it is sometimes loud; breakfast means your room smells vaguely of bacon in the morning if on a lower floor (may be a pro to some) - would not be my idea of a business hotel ps - Children's Pool at end of La Jolla cove is a nice place for kids to see seals and can couple with a meal over on Prospect St. (the Karl Strauss brewery is very kid-friendly)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay For Visiting Tourist Spots”
Reviews.Author: Dee-in-DC
Reviews.Content: I checked reviews on tripadvisor before I selected this Embassy La Jolla for my San Diego stay. I would agree that the daily fee for parking was high, but worth it for me. I have a 3-year old and a 20-month old - trying to find parking on the street would have been too much for me. It was simpler to walk into the garage and go. We stayed for a week - November 22 to November 28. The staff was friendly and helpful. My room was clean. The refrigerator was the right size for the things I purchased (drinks, soy milk, snack cheese). We were right across from a mall and a few blocks from Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. (hey, everyone has their special requirements!). There is an advantage to getting "free" breakfast quickly and easily every morning for a family of four. The food was good enough and served quickly enough to get us going in the morning. It was one less thing to deal with or worry about. I say "free" because it is probably factored into the price. In terms of location, La Jolla is perfect for going downtown to the Zoo or driving up to LegoLand and Disneyland. We tried to get to every destination by 9AM to maximize the time spent and let my son take his afternoon nap. We had no traffic in any direction, so we were either lucky or the location is perfect for traffic avoidance. Our wedding anniversary occurred during the trip. My wife called the hotel weeks prior to surprise me with gifts and goodies. Well it worked because I forgot it was our anniversary. Embassy Suites gave us a Movie package which included a free in-room movie rental and popcorn. All-in-all, nice place, great location, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay with 2 toddlers”
Reviews.Author: richm456
Reviews.Content: I just finished an excellent stay at the Embassy Suites. I visited with my 2 toddlers and elderly mother. We had a fabulous stay. The staff was extremely friendly and I look forward to my next visit. The Suite was perfect for our group and was clean and comfortable. The koi pond in the lobby was probably the highlight for my two little guys. They couldn't get enough of looking at the fish. Definitely give these folks your business.

Reviews.Title: “Great family post holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: vacation_junkie03
Reviews.Content: We were a family with 2 little kids. We stayed in a suite with king side bed. There was enough room for a twin air mattress and full size air mattress in the bedroom! We got a corner room which was angular and seems smaller by comparison to a regular room. It was odd that the bathroom didn't have any towel bars. There were a couple of hooks by the sink where we hung the hand towels but the bath towels had to be draped over the shower or the bathroom door hook. Also, if you have a baby and need a crib, the hotel only has metal crib. Bring your own crib paddings - they don't suppy the bumper guards and they don't have Graco Pack and Play (which the ES in Flagstaff in AZ did). We didn't bring our bumperguard and had to use several sheets and packing tape to create one. The hotel atrium is beautiful and the koi pond was a favorite with the kids. Bring lots of quarters as it costs to get fish food to feed the fat fish. The breakfast is delicious as usual. Get there early as the lines get very long after 8am. The free drinks was the favorite with the adults. We brought in 'to go' food every night and enjoyed the drinks with our dinner. Overall, it was very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: I've ready the other reviews. I'll be back. Clean, quiet, easy access to several freeways. The only downside are the too-low-wattage compact fluorescent bulbs. It just wasn't bright enough for my 55-year-old eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vegas411
Reviews.Content: We are regular ES customers, but the first time at this property. Easy, courteous check-in with ample garage parking minus the $17 a day fee. The King room had large flat panel in living room, but the room was slightly smaller than most other ES we stayed and it lacked the wetbar feature, but stiil had a granite top sink, fridge and micro. Bedroom was very clean, and had a down comforter. The TV was not a flat panel, but who comes to such a beautiful city to watch tv in the room? Overall stay was near perfect, the made to order breakfast was very good, as they even had a large assortment of fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive, courteous, beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mishabisha
Reviews.Content: Judging by the other reviews of this hotel, it seems my wonderful experience was only one of many. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday (a kind of "stay-cation" if you will) for one night. I booked the room online through Embassy Suites' website and chose to purchase the "Romance package" in addition. The package included a bottle of champagne and a small box of See's candy. (I think it also came with robes and slippers, but I can't remember if that was standard or if it came with the package.) The price might seem a little high, but it was totally worth it. The boyfriend had no idea about the "romance" part and I wanted to keep it a surprise. I wrote special instructions when I made the reservation that I wanted the champagne already set up in the room when we arrived. Check-in was a breeze...the front desk clerk was very courteous and informative (those kind of manners seem to be almost non-existent these days) and told us about a complimentary happy hour in the lobby. They offered mixed drinks, wine, and beer, as much as you could drink from 5-7. We had a couple drinks and watched some football in the gorgeous atrium-like lobby. The room we were assigned was on the top floor, in the corner. It was immaculate and the view was incredible. Best of all, the champagne was on fresh ice and the chocolate and robes were all laid out. My boyfriend was so surprised he was almost in tears. I was ecstatic! I took him to dinner at The Melting Pot, a fondue restaurant in La Jolla, and we asked the valet guys to call us a cab. They offered to take us in their own hotel shuttle for free and even picked us up when we called after our meal! The pool was great, the spa stays open until midnight, and the sauna is exceptional. We DEFINITELY want to go back and can't say enough positive things about Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Emabassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Major12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Embassy Suites properties around the country and I must say this is one of the best. Great location and service! The king suite room was very nice in all respects and everything functioned properly. Every staff member I spoke to was very helpful and respectful - front desk personnel were some of the best - very knowledgeable in all respects. The morning breakfast and the afternoon managers reception were both great. Nice decor throughout the hotel. The hotel restaurant has a limited menue, but the one night we ate there was very good. Lots of other restaurants nearby and a PF Changs right next door which was wonderful. My only ding against this property is the rediculous $17 parking fee in their garage. I can see no justification for that amount, but I was aware of it going in and it wasn't a deal breaker for me. This is the only Embassy Suites I've been to with an actual parking garage - guess they're trying to pay it off quickly. Other than that issue this is a great property and one of the best I've ever stayed at around the country.

Reviews.Title: “great staying”
Reviews.Author: amantedelanaturaleza
Reviews.Content: excellent room, big, clean and very confortable. good breakfast included. complimentary drink every afternoon. good business center. US$17 parking fee. Good location....far from the beach , but very accesible to all main san diego attractions. Ideal for families with kids

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: richardallman
Reviews.Content: We were booking late and found a good deal on a hotel in La Jolla, which turned out to be the Embassy Suites. We were afraid that the hotel would be less frendly and less willing to accomodate us because we booked on hotwire, but we never experienced that. I'd definately book through hotwire again just because of all the money we saved. Anyway, the hotel itself was pretty nice - about what you'd expect from Embassy Suites. Rooms were clean, big LCD TV in the living room, no complaints there. Also, the continental breakfast was EXCELLENT. The only problem was it was packed. We had to wait in line for twenty minutes before we got to it. Then, the hotel ran out of trays so we had to wait for those. The hotel was completely booked during our stay and it was overrun with families, which isn't bad unless you don't like kids. Also, two of the four elevators broke on the second day which was an absolute disaster. One time i waited ten minutes to go down and get some eggs. I got down there, waited in line for another twenty minutes, then waited another ten minutes for an elevator to go back to my room. The whole ordeal took like 40 minutes on a morning we were trying to get going early. Overall, though, I'd definately reccomend the Embassy Suites La Jolla, especially to families looking for a great beach getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkyasu60
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 9/4 thru 9/7. We had no problems checking in or getting a porter to help with the luggage. (With a wife and 2 teenage girls it was a lot!). The hotel was spaces and friendly. The rooms had a large living room with a nice flat screen TV., and the bed room was a good size with a regular TV. The morning free Hot breakfast was very nice and had a very short line for it , it must have been the beginning of the off season. The pool was nice and hot tub too. Parking was 17.oo dallors a day with no problems with spaces. It was close to every place needed to go, Sea World, Sea port Village, La Jolla Beach. The staff was very friendly to us and with fast response with any requests that were given and directions to places that we were going to. The only little problem I had not being a Drinker is the get together the hotel gives in the evening, free drinks of alcohol , soda juices. But the chips, goldfish, pretzels were kind of cheap, would have like more of some pastries or some better snacks. But for the price of a State Gov rate 110.00 a night I really can’t complain. It was a Great experience

Reviews.Title: “Two bad apple's can spoil the whole barrel”
Reviews.Author: MalbertSF
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review a bit earlier than expected. You see I was woken up at 5:15AM by a brand new flat panel TV in the breakfast area blasting the news to all those suckers who happen to be sleeping on the sofa bed in the front room of the 2 room suite. If you have never stayed at an embassy suites they have an atrium that all rooms face so it's either really cool or really annoying depending on whether you are deaf or not. When I could no longer take the before dawn intrusion I did what most reasonable people would do, called the front desk. What I got is "I will call and ask them to turn it down" funny cause the lobby is what ,30 feet from the blaring TV. So I laid back down waiting for the peace and quite I expect at 5 in the morning. Gues what? someone turned it up. I must have cheesed them off by politely asking them to do, I don't know, their job maybe. I should be ashamed of myself for bothering them and just shut my yap, but funny thing is, I then got a bit mad. I called down again. "I can still hear it" "sir I asked them to turn it down" "OK then why does it seem to be louder?" "(sigh) I will call them again" Click. She hung up on me. I must have bothered her again I guess. So again I tucked myself under the cheesy velor blanket trying to recapture my dream. 15 minutes pass. No change in the volume. I heard every news story, every commercial, every Olympic fanfare (It was NBC). That was IT. I called again "I will get dressed and go down there and turn it down myself" Silence (from the front desk I could almost hear her thinking "whatever" ) Click she hung up on me again. So I get dressed and go on down (hey I was up on the 7th floor) and walked up to the offending TV. Not a single guest watching it. Just blasting to no one in particular. I see a staff member walking by and I ask "can you help me turn this down" and she barks at me "we don't have the remote, we don't know how to do it" and she walks away. What have I done to deserve this? I checked my breath and my zipper, my nose and my BO and I honestly don't know why I was getting them so upset. I was really really bothering them maybe I should just shut up go back to my room and pay my bill and leave them alone, you know give myself a time out. But hey, I am an adult, I have atayed at maybe 15 different ES and booked trade shows and meeting for a living so I am used to dealing with hotels. The good ones trya nd make their guest feel special, the bad ones, well read on. So, last chance, I walk up to the front desk "Hi, I am the guy who called about the TV and the folks in the breakfast area says that they don't have the remote" "OK sir I just got here what is the problem" so I repeat my sad tale and she say's to me "what floor are you on?" the 7th. She rolls her eyes in disbelief that I could hear it way up there. So she say's "let me ask Ellen she took your call" so she steps back and I hear some mumbling and she walsk back and says "Sir Ellen turned it down herself she has the remote" "OK its still blasting, it's not down enough" . "Yes it is, sir it's our ploicy to turn the TV's on at 6AM and we can't do anything about it" Now i am normaly a tolerant fellow who expects a bit of noise from other guest rooms (kids Tv's or just chatter from folks walking down the hall) but I surely did not exext to get "attitude" from the front desk for just asking them to turn down the volume. So I say to her "It's 5:45, and I'ts been on for a while" "sir that's our policy, how long will you be with us" "One more night" "Sorry we can't help you" I was flabbergassed. Why in the world would I make this stuff up. Do they seriously think I sit there at 5 AM waiting to complain about something. That I am making it all up or just over sensitive? Yes they do, yes they do because what happened next summed up the whole bitter exchange. I said to her "I hope someone would please go over and listen to the volume" Ellen never showed her face and her flunky just looked at me and shrugged her shoulders. So I grabed one of those "tell us how we are doing" cards and said "Someone is going to hear about this" and as I walked away I heard her say under her breath "stupid" I turned around and said "what di you say" and she say's "I said It's early" [--] lady. I heard it correctly the first time. Remember I am the guy that can hear a TV from seven stories up. She never checked it out, never smiled or acknowleged my concern and gte theis, as i walked away she called me STUPID. Thanks Ellen, Thanks rude employee who barked at me in the lounge "we don't know how to do it" and a big thank you to the front desk clerk who rolled her eyes ignored my reasonable request and called me stupid. Fianlly a big thank you to Embassy Suites La Jolla. I will never forget you. You know just how to treat your guest, Like [--]. Wow,and it only took me 229.00 to figure it out. Otherwise the hotel is clean convienent and the rest of the staff was wonderful. Especially the young man that checked us in. Will I be back? If I did i would be, well STUPID.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CafeBohemia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location just outside the village of La Jolla between two of the major freeways (but far enough away from them that it is quiet). You can get to all popular San Diego area attractions very easily and quickly. A large upscale shopping centre, Westfield UTC, is directly across the street. Rooms are typically Embassy Suites ... fairly large and comfortable. This property has recently been updated and has flat screen TVs and some nicer, modern furniture. The only downsides ... windows do not open and the air conditioner unit in our room was rather noisy. Pool was nice. Breakfast was also decent with a nice outdoor eating area. All in all, a very good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place except for customer service”
Reviews.Author: BrendaLu
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay overall but I was met with some unexpected surprises. Parking at $17/night was the most disconcerting. I found one clerk unhelpful on two occasions but a second was both helpful and accommodating. After all is said and done this was a great place and the made to order breakfast definitely added value to our stay (probably just enough to offset the $17 nightly parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Billing surprises”
Reviews.Author: verouser
Reviews.Content: The billing had to be corrected for overcharges twice. We were charged for tv channels that we did not view. The free channels are not even worth watching. Everyone is charged $17.00 each night for parking. I had to prove that I did not park on the property for this charge to be removed. The parking is very tight and my friend had alot of trouble with his truck. The rooms are nice but for the inconviniences, it was not worth the money that was paid.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Takemeawayplz
Reviews.Content: I try to write a review when i return from my vacations. I love this site because it gives you a heads up on what to expect. I think I owe it to all your site visitors to tell them about the good , the bad and the ugly when it comes to my hotel stays. Here we go.... Pros wonderful location. Mall across the street. Great place to stay if you plan to explore southern california. Everything is close by. We went to Sea World, Zoo, Disneyland and La. Hotel is beautiful. I read before the trip they remodeled , they did a great job because everyone in the family loved it. Plenty of room. We have a family of four and we were very comfortable in the mini suite. BREAKFAST WAS GREEEAT! Get there early to avoid line for the omelets. Loved the pool( one night it was a little wild because of some teenagers but it was ok) and free internet access in the lounge. It was really nice to be able to check email. Cons PARKING! PARKING! PARKING! 17 dollars a day are they serious? word to the wise PARK ON THE STREET. Its free and a short walk to the hotel. Everyday I laughed at the poor suckers who paid to park there. One night we parked on the street right in front of the hotel, I seen a family coming out of the parking complex. We got to the hotel at the same time they did. Even though they paid 17 dollars they still had to walk about a city block to get to the hotel. We paid nothing and got the same convience they did. Only problem when we went to check out they tried to charge us 80 dollars for parking. As you can tell I took pride in not parking there and paying those outrageous fees. I explained this to the desk clerk and the charges were removed. Overall we had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel (not parking) to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Weekday dream - weekend nightmare”
Reviews.Author: fanofamerica
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews of just about every hotel in San Diego, we finally decided on The Embassy due to location, price and the fact it had been newly refurbished. The rooms were beautifully decorated and very spacious. Breakfast was the usual hot buffet, but it was plentiful and the evening receptions were lovely. Parking was a problem as the spaces in the car park were small and it was often full. We were very happy with the location, and the staff were very helpful. In fact, our stay from Wednesday to Friday was brilliant, but come Friday night, it turned into a kids playground with the arrival of teams for a water polo competition. Now I do not blame the hotel, I blame the parents. What are parents thinking allowing their kids to run wild all over the hotel? On more than one occasion we had the kids knocking on our room door, riding the lifts from floor to floor and then running all the way around the hotel shouting. Do parents have no consideration for other people or can they just not be bothered to take control of their kids? The weekend spoiled what would have otherwise been a brilliant hotel and we will definitely stay there again if its during the week!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Parents AND Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: topterp
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Embassy Suite La Jolla with wife and 2 kids in early June 2008. What a treat! Hotel was clean, quiet, updated and conveniently located for our visits to San Diego and sites to the north. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Bedroom and suite were large enough for the four of us to spread out and be comfortable without crowding. Bathroom was clean and large as well. Public areas (lounge, pool, lobby) were also inviting and comfortable. Free hot breakfast buffet and manager's reception daily were awesome and only added to the great value and experience. Only minutes from downtown La Jolla for ocean, restaurants. Also within 20 minutes from Legoland. If head to downtown San Diego after rush hour, can make it there in under 25 minutes as well. Parking was convenient and cost $17 per day. Highly recommend this for families vacationing in the area. Also, I did business work while at hotel and that worked well too. High speed internet was fast and reliable. Desks in both the suite room and the bedroom made for easy computing. Would recommend this to business travelers as well. Well done Embassy Suites La Jolla! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Made trip with a toddler a great success!”
Reviews.Author: anxone
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in San Diego with my husband and 21 month old little boy, and we had a fantastic experience with the Embassy Suites La Jolla. We arrived the Saturday before Memorial Day and stayed through the following Saturday. On the weekend the hotel was full of kids there for a soccer tournament so it was quite lively, but we never had any issues with them. During the week it was extremely relaxing at this hotel. My little boy loved the koi pond, and the breakfast was excellent and saved a lot of time and money. In the evenings he enjoyed the pretzels and goldfish, then after he was in bed my husband or I would run down for a cocktail or a glass of wine. Having the separate bedroom was a lifesaver for us, as we could put him to bed in the bedroom, then stay in the living room and watch basketball on the awesome plasma TV. The rooms are decorated quite nicely, and I appreciated that the bedspreads seemed easily washable and very clean! We also enjoyed the indoor pool - though it is small it was never crowded, even during the busy family weekends. I liked the fact that it was out of the sun, since we spent most of our days outside. My toddler would wake up each day and the first words out of his mouth were always 'the pool!' Now we have been home a few days and if I ask him if he had fun on vacation he grins and says 'the pool!' He also loved the glass elevators and being able to look down on the people and fish in the atrium. The computer room was also extremely convenient for us to be able to run down and check our email, and we never had to wait for a computer, even on the busy days. It was also great having the big mall across the street. This is a great location - very centrally located to anywhere around San Diego you would want to go. The only tiny downside to this hotel has been mentioned before - the parking. More often than not we couldn't get our keycard to work, a minor annoyance but an annoyance nonetheless. It is also a little awkward getting out of the garage once you're parked. I think the $17 charge is more than made up for by the breakfast and drinks at night though. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful - we felt right at home during our entire stay. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: baloney56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a month in 2004 and found it to be pleasant. Well, now they've renovated the place and it's lovely with updated furniture in the rooms and lobby. The complimentary breakfast was good; the usual omelets, pancakes and French Toast, with fresh fruit, juices yogurt, etc. The evening reception can't be beat; free drinks including hard liquor and a few snacks. We were there over a weekend and had no problem with kids running wild; they were for the most part polite and quiet. It's not in the center of town by any means, but it is less than 30 minutes to the beach, the zoo, Old Town or the Wild Animal Park. The only drawback we found was the price for parking in their lot, but with ample FREE parking on the street if you're willing to walk up to a block or two, that's not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroDiva
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there while I was on business. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from a shopping mall comprised of the large anchor stores of Sears, Nordstroms, and Macys. There's an array of restaurants nearby. We were happy with the spacious suite. The only glitch was housekeeping was slow in cleaning the room and it was about 3 pm when they arrived. If you are a late riser for breakfast, there are long lines for food after 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family to stay”
Reviews.Author: indecisivetravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over Presidents day weekend. We arrived Saturday evening and checked right in and got to our room. Our room was nice and clean and had everything we needed, including a plasma TV. When we returned from dinner the parking garage was full. Fortunately one of the guys that works in the lobby helped us find a place to park our car. The hotel was was totally booked mainly because of a hockey tournament. There were several kids running around playing in the elevators. I was surprised the parents were letting them do this. Having boys ages 6 and 9 I was tolerant of their antics, but would never allow mine to do run loose in a hotel. The breakfast selection was good. There were 3 chefs for cooking eggs so the omelet line was never very long. The kids had a lot of fun swimming in the pool. I was glad the pool was indoor since the weather wasn't very nice. I was dissappointed the hot tub wasn't open during most of our stay because it was being re-tiled. The hotel is in a very convenient location. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Salme
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over a one-week period, spanning one weekend. Although it said on the website that portions of the hotel were under construction, they did not disclose that the hotel restaurant was closed, and that therefore they were running the morning breakfasts out of the lobby. Unfortunately, the lobby was also under construction, the koi pond was drained and very unattractive, and contractors worked on it daily. What they didn't disclose was the planned carpeting re-do, which took place beginning on Monday. They didn't disclose it until the Friday before the work began on Monday, then only by slipping a memo under our doors. They did not post signs anywhere. Like many Embassy Suites, the business week belongs to businessmen. Unfortunately, the weekends belong to the kids. A city-wide little-league hockey tournament filled the hotel with kids, and the staff made no effort to control the wildness of these 75+ kids. They ran in the halls, yelled across the atrium, and played hockey in their stocking feet in the halls, the atrium, and outside. It is untenable, especially because the atrium structure only serves to magnify sound exponentially as the sound rises. The food was ok, though not stellar for the exorbitant prices. For some unexplained reason, the AC stopped working the last day we were there, and thought the engineer responded quickly that it would be back on shortly, it was not. Then it took 30 minutes for the engineer to even respond to a second call. Even with the occasional availability of the low-priced rates, I would not stay here again. They just don't disclose the truth about the state of the hotel. On the plus side, it is centrally located, next to UTC shopping center and lots of eateries. However, I cannot recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale feel, great value!!”
Reviews.Author: rierie78
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights over the weekend between Christmas and New Years, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel has just undergone a complete renovation, and it shows. Everything is brand new, modern, and beautiful. The suite was very generously sized, had a big flat screen TV in the living/dining room area, extremely comfortable bed, and (of course) the huge, delicious, full breakfast every morning and free cocktails every evening!!! We thought the location was great as well. Whether you plan to go into town or explore more of North County, everything you would want to do is within a 15-20 minute drive. There were many really great restaurants that you could even walk to, including P.F. Changs that shares a parking lot with the hotel and a yummy mexican restaurant named Cozymel's just up La Jolla Village from the hotel. The only complaint we had was that there was no included high speed hookup (an amenity that travelers are beginning to expect, we paid something like $25 for internet for our 3-day stay) and that the parking was expensive ($17 per day) for very narrow spaces in the garage. One could say that the free (and very extensive) breakfast and evening cocktails would counterbalance these expenses. We would highly recommend this hotel and will most likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but remodeling is bad for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tangster
Reviews.Content: The property is centrally located, in between I-5 and HWY 805, and is literally across the street from the Westfield mall. The property has completed a multi-million dollar upgrade of all its room, but the downside is that they are now in the phase of remodeling of the breakfast area. Breakfast is temporarily being served in their restaurant, which is undersized and not equipped to handle the masses of people. Unless you get there early, you will not find a seat and will end up bringing breakfast back to your room. However, the room we stayed in was stylishly done, with modern touches and a neutral color scheme. Nice flat panel with HD TV. Parking at $17 per night is a little steep as well. Overall, a nice stay for a family of five.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for unsupervised kids to run wild!!”
Reviews.Author: SGV
Reviews.Content: I am not a big fan of most Embassy Suite's properties but this one accomadation wise is good.The rooms are updated and so much better then any other Embassy I've been to in a long time.We stayed in an executive suite and it has more room with a dining table for six and a seperate vanity type (though dimily lit) vanity in the bedroom.It has a flatscreen in the living area and a flat screen fullbacked TV in the bedroom.Bathroom is OK no fan in the bathroom so showering really fogs it up. Ok the not so great part was that the majority of the people there had kids in a soccer tornaments in the area.These kids ran wild all night yelling and running and slamming doors.It was so bad my two kids who were there for the same reason wanted to change rooms because they got no sleep due to the noise!The front desk staff told me the parents get mad when asked to please keep their kids under control.........??? Front desk staff was very helpful and professional. The breakfast was ok ,the managers reception in the evening was not so great ,potato chips,pretzels were the snacks and the drink line was not worth standing in.Trying to get some napkins at the breakfast was like I had insulted the worker I had asked for them from and check to make sure the plates are clean (really) The atrium area is still under construction and parking is $17 a day although you could park on the street. It is probably a quieter place to stay during the week when there are non supervised kids running everywhere.When your own kids are bothered by it you know it's bad! The pictures of the rooms on the hotel website are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyhchen
Reviews.Content: The rooms are newly renovated, look fresh, clean, and comfortable. Good breakfast spread in the morning. On the expensive side but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Kind and Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: CMFM
Reviews.Content: Our thanks and appreciation to the staff at the Embassy Suites, La Jolla for a wonderful stay. Our family (six rooms worth) came together from throughout California for a 3 day weekend wedding event in La Jolla and we were able to make ourselves at home and have a great time in large part due to the kindness and attention of the Embassy Suites staff. Check in was efficient and welcoming and all of our rooms were ready, clean and comfortable. The front desk made sure my father (who is disabled),was appropriately accomodated. We enjoyed the breakfasts all together and though we were a large noisy group, the staff was cheerful and friendly also taking the time to visit with my father who wanted to show off his family. When we were racing out to the wedding location on Sunday morning, the concierge (Adam?) was extremely helpful in making an adjustment in our handicapped parking assignment, helped with loading Dad's wheel chair and walker and even printed out a map to the wedding location which saved us from getting lost on the way (like my brother :). This same young man also helped my parents considerably when they checked out the next day. There is a great business center that we used for some last minute communications and a convenient kiosk in the lobby to print boarding passes. Some of the family enjoyed the nice pool and steam room. Parking is a challenge if you mind paying $17 per day (ouch) - it is in the heart of an expensive area so it is understandable, but it can add up. Very nice upscale shopping across the street and down the road about a mile or two, more shopping (Trader Joes and Whole Foods) if you are staying longer and want to eat in. Unlike some ES locations, the acoustics here are very good, we did not hear much noise from the atrium/breakfast area (whether you were on 3rd, 5th 7th or 11th floor like we were). And the rooms were very quiet as well. I was encouraged by the other positive comments on this thread and my expectations were met and then some. I get to travel fairly often for work and pleasure and stay at ES's from time to time and this is the nicest one yet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all areas”
Reviews.Author: SearayBob
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Aug. 24-28. The weekend is busy with families, however Sun. evening thru Tues. quieted down considerably. Rooms are large and surprisingly quiet considering the amount of kids in the building. Beds were fantasic, better than at home! Breakfast was as advertised, virtually anything you could ask for is available, hot, and fresh! The adult bevedge selection at the daily managers reception will satisfy whatever you desire, and it is free. Staff was courteous and professional. If you are new to the area and looking for tips on things to see, you may be fortunate enough to meet a guest services reprentative who is stationed just across from the main check in desk. His name is Paige. He provided us with suggestions and information that were most helpful. There is the $17.00 parking fee, get over it. It is well publisized in every hotel review forum, and is also noted on the hotel website. You will get double that back in breakfast and cocktails. The area just does not have a lot of available parking so it will be a premium. We will definitly book here again on a return trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: ckeaton
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this property for one week during our visit to the San Diego area and we enjoyed our stay. This is a good hotel for families. The suite provided plenty of space for my wife and I and our 2 boys, age 3 and 7. The room and public areas, including the pool area, are very nice and clean. There is a great breakfast (come early or you may have to stand in line), including a nice buffet and cooked to order omelets. My wife and I did enjoy a relaxing cocktail after a day out with the boys, as well. There are also may restaurants and a mall within walking distance. If you are going to be in San Diego this is a very good option that we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chamberman
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to California to visit my newly relocated brother, who recommended the Embassy Suites. (He also told us about TripAdviser.) We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The staff was quite friendly. Our room was large and clean. The price seemed a little expensive, but I found out that most hotels in the area are just as expensive. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family weekend in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla. Got upgraded room via Hilton Honors. Large enough for 5 people--wife and me, sons 18, 15 and daughter 10 yo. Breakfast was good, did not make back for happy hour in evening. Very noisy--there was some type of soccer camp nearby and just about everyone who was there was a 12-14 yo girl in soccer gear, running up and down the hotel! Parking is an issue in this hotel, not only do you have to pay, but on one evening, the parking lot was full! Got to park in the valet parking for the PF Chang's next door, which was at no cost, as long as we left early in the morning. Location is good, across the street from regional mall, very nearby UCSD and close enough to downtown San Diego and Mission Bay. Traffic on the freeways is really nasty at rush hour and on Sunday evenings. Took 2 1/2 hours to go 60 miles from Orange Coast Plaza on a Friday evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun For Our Family”
Reviews.Author: 4famfun
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites, La Jolla was the perfect place for our family of four to stay for our first California Vacation, as we normally travel to see family back east. The 2-room suite was perfect for us, it was roomy, clean, well decorated with many of the conveniences of home. Upon walking into the room, there was Living Room Area with a pull out sofa bed, a large ottoman, a comfy chair, a table with 3 chairs and a flat screen tv. Moving further into the suite there was a bi-fold door and behind that was a microwave, small re-frig and a counter top to prepare and store snacks. On the opposite wall was a bar with a coffee maker, ice bucket and a sink.................there was even a cupboard below for storage of snacks etc. as well. You then go through a door, and to the left was a roomy and very nice bathroom with a tub/shower combo, a hairdryer and stocked with towels and toiletries. To the right, across from the bathroom, was a large closet with mirrored doors, there was a shelf & rod for clothes, a suitcase valet, and an iron& ironing board. At the end of that hall was the bedroom, with 2 double beds, my husband and I had one bed and our 3 and 5 year old boys shared the other bed, there was a dresser/vanity with an ottoman. On the other end of the dresser was a flat screen tv. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful with many choices, cereal, friut, pastries, bagels, donuts, yougurt, juice coffee and best of all the hot breakfast bar. Grab a small bowl and choose your own ingredients, hand it to the chef and they make it into a scramble or omelett, you also can have pancakes, french toast, bacon & sausage. We too enjoyed the complimentary late afternoon/evening manager's happy hour. Crackers, chips, salsa, drinks with or without alcohol. The pool was nice, but could get a little noisy when there was more than 1-2 families with kids at a time.........Not all parents were good about keeping their children from making to much noise, or hogging the entire pool. Three suggestions would have made the stay better: Bigger Beds Better Parking Rates - $17 a day was steep Cable TV - only had the East Coast Feed for the Kids channels, not good considering you are having fun in the sun all-day and then want the kids to settle down..........and their programing is already over by 3pm, because it was the East Coast Feed. We dealt with it, rented them a couple of programs..........but that too can add up on an extended stay. This was the best 6 night, 7 day stay with our boys ages 3 and 5 years old..............the 2-room suite was supper family friendly and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phiflyers
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at this hotel for a vacation weekend (Thursday July 19th-Sunday July 22nd) and were pretty pleased with our experience. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is about a mile off the highway and isolated from any highway noise. The hotel lobby was recently remodeled and it looked like they were putting the finishing touches on everyone when we checked in. The check-in process was very easy and we were in our room in no time after a long evening of traveling. The room was pretty spacious for the 3 of us and included an HD flat-screen in the "living room", mini-fridge, microwave, and even a bar-sink. 2 of us slept in the king-sized bed and 1 in the pull out queen sleeper sofa. The sleeping arrangements were very comfortable as we were able to close off the 2 sides of the suite for a little privacy. There were a couple of complaints that we had regarding the room and one of them ended up being addressed while we stayed there. The a/c system was very loud when it kicked on and would definitely wake up a light sleeper, and ended up waking me up on a few occasions. The first time we used the shower it would take forever to drain and the 2nd person taking a shower would always stand in a puddle of water. After making a call to the front desk they sent someone up to the room and it was fixed the next time we took a shower. Our rate, as well as everyone else's, included the great breakfast that they put on every morning. There is a large crowd in the breakfast area every day, but the spread that is available was one of the best I have seen in a hotel and we were all very pleased. We ordered room service 1 night and found the food to be very tasty and reasonably priced. A major that we had regarding the hotel itself was the elevators on Sunday (our check-out day). Everyone seemed rushed to get out of the hotel at the same time and this created a huge line at the elevators.
